trans-unit.source: Provides design-time support in a visual designer for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView"></xref> control.

In a visual designer, when you switch from Source to Design view, the markup source code that describes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control is parsed and a design-time version of the control is created on the design surface.
When you switch back to Source view, the design-time control is persisted to the markup source code and edited into the markup for the Web page.
The properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.FormViewDesigner> class provide the following functionality:

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.FormViewDesigner.ActionLists%2A> property returns a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> object, which typically contains an object that is derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> class for each level in the inheritance tree of the designer.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.FormViewDesigner.AutoFormats%2A> property returns a collection of formatting schemes for display in the **Auto Format** dialog box.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.FormViewDesigner.TemplateGroups%2A> property returns a collection of template groups for the templates of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView>.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.FormViewDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property always returns `true`, indicating that the designer creates a temporary copy of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> to generate the design-time markup.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.FormViewDesigner> class methods provide the following functionality:

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.FormViewDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method returns the markup that is used to render the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> at design time.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.FormViewDesigner.Initialize%2A> method prepares the designer to view, edit, and design the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView>.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.FormViewDesigner.OnSchemaRefreshed%2A> method is called when the schema of the data source for the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> changes.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.FormViewDesigner"></xref> class.

The .NET Framework internally constructs a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.FormViewDesigner> class when it creates the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control or a copy of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control on the design surface.
Gets the designer action list collection for this designer.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection"></xref> associated with this designer.
Gets the collection of automatic formatting schemes for display in the **Auto Format** dialog box.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormatCollection> object is populated from an XML-encoded member of an internal class.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormatCollection"></xref> that contains the predefined schemes for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView"></xref>.
Gets the markup that is used to render the associated control at design time.

If an item template has been defined for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.FormViewDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView.DataKeyNames%2A> collection of the control to an empty <xref:System.String> array if the schema for the data source cannot be obtained.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.FormViewDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> refreshes the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor> object to force a call to the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataBoundControlDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.FormViewDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> then calls the base method to generate the markup.

If no item template has been defined for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.FormViewDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.FormViewDesigner.GetEmptyDesignTimeHtml%2A> method to generate markup that renders to a placeholder.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> containing the markup used to render the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView"></xref> at design time.
Gets the markup text that is used to render a placeholder for the associated control at design time.

If the markup for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control does not include one of the item templates, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.FormViewDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.FormViewDesigner.GetEmptyDesignTimeHtml%2A> method, which generates the markup for a placeholder that contains instructions on how to edit template content and a message that an item template is required.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> containing markup text that renders to a placeholder on the design surface.
Prepares the designer to view, edit, and design the associated control.

The designer host calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.FormViewDesigner.Initialize%2A> method when it is ready to use the designer to render the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.FormViewDesigner.Initialize%2A> and its base methods configure properties and connect to events that are necessary for the operation of the designer.
The `component` parameter is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control that is associated with this designer or a copy of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView"></xref>, which implements an <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IComponent"></xref>.
Called when the schema of the data source for the associated control changes.

Unless the designer is in template editing mode or a field is being added or edited, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.FormViewDesigner.OnSchemaRefreshed%2A> method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.InvokeTransactedChange%2A> method, which in turn calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.OnComponentChanged%2A> method to update the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control to reflect the data source change.
Adds or removes properties in the properties grid in a design host at design time, or provides new design-time properties that might correspond to properties on the associated control.
The properties for the class of the component.
Specifies whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.FormViewDesigner"></xref> control uses an outer table container to apply inline CSS style rules.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.FormViewDesigner> control uses an outer table container to apply inline style rule in the markup.
You can remove the outer table container by setting this property to `true`.
This provides flexibility in applying CSS style rules in the control markup.
`true` if the control uses an outer table container to apply inline CSS style rules; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`
Gets the number of sample rows for the associated control to display.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.FormViewDesigner.SampleRowCount%2A> always returns `2`.

This causes two page links to be displayed in the pager row of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control at design time, if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView.PagerSettings%2A> mode is numeric.
The number of sample rows.
Gets a collection of template groups for the fields of the associated control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.FormViewDesigner.TemplateGroups%2A> property constructs a collection of <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroup> objects, one for each control template in the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control.
The control templates are the header, footer, pager, item, edit item, insert item, and empty data.
The control template <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroup> elements contain a single <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateDefinition> object.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroupCollection"></xref> containing an element for each templated field in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView"></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether the designer should use a temporary copy rather than the actual control that is associated with the designer to generate the design-time markup.

Because the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.FormViewDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property is always true, the designer uses a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.View> control that contains a copy of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control to generate the design-time markup.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.View> control does not affect any persistence for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView>.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.FormViewDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property has been overridden to return `false`, the designer will use the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> itself to generate the design-time markup.
Always returns `true`.
